lines.content: Duke chatbot is a java program that helps you to manage your tasks
### `list` - displays a list of all tasks
Use this command when you want a list of all tasks you have added so far.
-> Here are the tasks in your list:
Duke lists command in a chronogical order based on time you add the tasks.
The first box of the task indicates the type of task (todo, event, deadline).
The second box indicates the completion. This is followed by the description of a task and date.
### `todo [description of the task] - add event to a list of tasks
Use this command when you want to add todo in the task.
Now you have 6 task in the list.
Duke adds the new todo do homework to the list.
### `event [description of the task] /at [date] ` - add todo to a list of tasks
Use this command when you want to add event in the task.
Now you have 6 task in the list.
Duke adds the event titled birthday party and its date.
Now you have 6 task in the list.
If no date has been specified by /at, Duke fills the date with nil.
### `Deadline [description of the task] /by [date]` - add deadline to a list of tasks
Use this command when you want to add event in the task.
Now you have 6 task in the list.
Duke adds the deadline assingment and the due date Monday.
Now you have 6 task in the list.
If no date has been specified by /by, Duke fills the date with nil.
Use this command when you want to mark the task.
Nice~ I've marked this task as *done*:
Task 2 (the number is given in the list) is marked complete.
Use this command when you want to unmark the task.
Okie~ I've marked this task as *not done* yet:
Task 2 (the number is given in the list) is marked complete.
Use this command when you want to delete the task.
Now you have 3 task in the list.
Task 2 (the number is given in the list) is now deleted.
Use this command to quit Duke chatbot
* Deadline class represents the task with a deadline
* @param description a description of the deadline task
* @return type of the task (deadline) marked by D and the description of the task followed by the date
private static final String greeting = "-> Hi I'm Duke~\n-> What can I do for you?";
private static final String listMsg = "-> Here are the tasks in your list:";
private static final String markMsg = "Nice~ I've marked this task as *done*:";
private static final String unmarkMsg = "Okie~ I've marked this task as *not done* yet:";
private static final String farewellMsg = "~*~*Cya soon*~*~!";
private static final String addTaskMsg = "Gotcha~ I've added this task:";
private static final String deleteTaskMsg = "Noted~ I've removed this task:";
* A method to display greeting message
* A method to display the list
* A method to display a task that has been marked
* A method to display a task that has been unmarked
* A method to display tasks that has been added
public void tasks(Task t, int total) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + total + " task in the list.");
* A method to display deleted task
public void delete(Task t, int total) {
System.out.println("Now you have " + total + " task in the list.");
* Duke class provides the functionality for Duke chatbot.
* Represents the list of tasks added by the user.
* For the display of the text on the console.
* Execute the command corresponding to the user input
* A method to mark the task complete
* @param cmd An array of String containing the user input split by whitespace
System.out.println("The second argument of the " + cmd[0] + " must be an integer.");
* A method to unmark the task that had been marked complete
* @param cmd An array of String containing the user input split by whitespace
System.out.println("The second argument of the " + cmd[0] + " must be an integer.");
* A method to add  a new todo into tasks list
* @param cmd An array of String containing the user input split by whitespace
* A method to add  a new event into tasks list
* @param cmd An array of String containing the user input split by whitespace
* A method to add  a new deadline into tasks list
* @param cmd An array of String containing the user input split by whitespace
* A method to delete an existing task in tasks list
* @param cmd An array of String containing the user input split by whitespace
System.out.println("The second argument of the " + cmd[0] + " must be an integer.");
* EmptyDescriptionException is a class for handling exception where there is
* no user input or the field required by the command is empty.
super("OOPS!!! You forgot to type in your command.");
* @parm field that is required by the command
super("OOPS!!! The description of a " + field + " cannot be empty.");
* Event class represents an event task.
* @param description a description of the deadline task
* @return type of the task (event) marked by E and the description of the task followed by the date
* ListOutOfBOund is a class for handling exception when user selected a task that
* is out of bound from the current list
* @param num is a invalid task number selected by the user
super("OOPS!!! You exceeded the bound!!\nTask " + num + " does not exist.");
* A class representing and holding functionality of task
* Store a description of a task
* Store a boolean indicating completion of the task
* @param description a description of the deadline task
* A method that display completion status in string
* A method that mark the task as complete
* A method that mark the task as incomplete
* @return status icon followed by a description of a task
* Todo class represents an todo task.
* @param description a description of the deadline task
* @return type of the task (event) marked by E and the description of the task followed by the date
* EmptyDescriptionException is a class for handling unknown commands
super("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means...");
